commentBody:
The fans and owners are complicit in the game of football. Both want instant
gratification - win now. Both permit the impermanence of a team becoming a part of the community. Losing season? Fire somebody. (It is, after all, the one-percenters who own the teams and their behavior is an example of the disregard for the communities. And the fans agree!) Oakland announced no public money nor land for a new stadium. It's a start. Let the one-percenters spend their own money on their teams. If the team owns the land and the stadium, they'll think more long-term and remain in the community and develop a true following. A losing season or two? Part of the ebb and flow of
athletics. The owners and fans need to grow up. They're in this together.
